required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Special Survey on Parkinson's Disease (PD) Patients Without Concomitant Use of L-Dopa
clinical_study.official_title: Pramipexole Special Survey on Patients Without Concomitant Use of L-Dopa

brief_summary.textblock: The survey is conducted to collect safety and effectiveness information in Parkinson's Disease patients treated with Pramipexole without concomitant L-Dopa supplementation in the daily clinical settings in Japan.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Adverse Events, Adverse Drug Reactions, Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: The aim of this Post Marketing Surveillance (PMS) was to obtain safety data in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients without concomitant use of levodopa for 3 years.

secondary_outcome.description: Investigators evaluation of the PD symptoms on a rating scale of 5 categories (very much improved, much improved, minimally improved, no effect, and unassessable).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 36 months (or at the time of discontinuation)
secondary_outcome.description: Motor examination is assessed by 27 questionnaire items in UPDRS Part III section. Each item is scored from 0 (best) to 4 (worst), and the total score of UPDRS Part III is from 0 (best) to 108 (worst). A decrease in the score means improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Modified Hoehn & Yahr Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 36 months (or at the time of discontinuation)
secondary_outcome.description: A severity of PD symptom are assessed by Modified Hoehn & Yahr rating scale. This scale consist of 10 levels including additional evaluation levels defined in Japan. Ten levels are described by 0 (best), 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 4.5, 5 (worst).

study_pop.textblock: Parkinson's disease patients in daily clinical settings

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients with Parkinson's disease who do not receive L-Dopa supplementation
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients should have been treated according to the Japanese insert slip

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: BI-Sifrol® Tablets dose: 0.125 mg, 0.5 mg mode of administration: oral

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: The number of patients enrolled was 416. The number of case report form which were collected was 364. Moreover the number of patients analyzed as safety analysis was 346 because 18 patients were excluded due to protocol violations.

outcome.title: Proportion of Adverse Events, Adverse Drug Reactions, Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: The aim of this Post Marketing Surveillance (PMS) was to obtain safety data in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients without concomitant use of levodopa for 3 years.
outcome.population: 364 patients had available case report forms. Patients excluded: 5 patients with no visit since the first prescription, 12 irregularly enrolled patients, 9 excluded from analysis according to regulatory requirement, and 1 patient with no safety data available. As a result, there were 346 patients in the safety analysis set.

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: Substance (INN): Pramipexole Trade name: BI-Sifrol® Pharmaceutical form: Tablet Source: Marketed products (There was no investigational products in this PMS) Unit strength: 0.125 mg and 0.5 mg Daily dose: Approved dose range (From 0.25 mg/day to 4.5 mg/day) Duration of use: 3 years Route of administration: Orally

measure.title: Proportion of Adverse Events, Adverse Drug Reactions, Serious Adverse Events
measure.description: The aim of this Post Marketing Surveillance (PMS) was to obtain safety data in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients without concomitant use of levodopa for 3 years.
measure.population: 364 patients had available case report forms. Patients excluded: 5 patients with no visit since the first prescription, 12 irregularly enrolled patients, 9 excluded from analysis according to regulatory requirement, and 1 patient with no safety data available. As a result, there were 346 patients in the safety analysis set.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement
outcome.description: Investigators evaluation of the PD symptoms on a rating scale of 5 categories (very much improved, much improved, minimally improved, no effect, and unassessable).
outcome.population: There were 346 patients in the safety analysis set. Patients excluded from this population: 5 because of administration to patients who didn’t suffer from PD and 2 with no efficacy data available. As a result, 339 patients were evaluated for efficacy.

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: BI-Sifrol® Tablets dose: 0.125 mg, 0.5 mg mode of administration: oral

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement
measure.description: Investigators evaluation of the PD symptoms on a rating scale of 5 categories (very much improved, much improved, minimally improved, no effect, and unassessable).
measure.population: There were 346 patients in the safety analysis set. Patients excluded from this population: 5 because of administration to patients who didn’t suffer from PD and 2 with no efficacy data available. As a result, 339 patients were evaluated for efficacy.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III Total Score
outcome.description: Motor examination is assessed by 27 questionnaire items in UPDRS Part III section. Each item is scored from 0 (best) to 4 (worst), and the total score of UPDRS Part III is from 0 (best) to 108 (worst). A decrease in the score means improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 36 months (or at the time of discontinuation)
outcome.population: The number of patients (291) means a population who have the assessment of UPDRS Part III total score at baseline and at least one post-visit after administration of pramipexole.

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: BI-Sifrol® Tablets dose: 0.125 mg, 0.5 mg mode of administration: oral

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III Total Score
measure.description: Motor examination is assessed by 27 questionnaire items in UPDRS Part III section. Each item is scored from 0 (best) to 4 (worst), and the total score of UPDRS Part III is from 0 (best) to 108 (worst). A decrease in the score means improvement.
measure.population: The number of patients (291) means a population who have the assessment of UPDRS Part III total score at baseline and at least one post-visit after administration of pramipexole.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Modified Hoehn & Yahr Rating Scale
outcome.description: A severity of PD symptom are assessed by Modified Hoehn & Yahr rating scale. This scale consist of 10 levels including additional evaluation levels defined in Japan. Ten levels are described by 0 (best), 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 4.5, 5 (worst).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at 36 months (or at the time of discontinuation)
outcome.population: The number of patients (295) means a population who have the assessment of Modified Hoehn & Yahr rating scale at baseline and at least one post-visit after administration of pramipexole.

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: BI-Sifrol® Tablets dose: 0.125 mg, 0.5 mg mode of administration: oral

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Modified Hoehn & Yahr Rating Scale
measure.description: A severity of PD symptom are assessed by Modified Hoehn & Yahr rating scale. This scale consist of 10 levels including additional evaluation levels defined in Japan. Ten levels are described by 0 (best), 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 4.5, 5 (worst).
measure.population: The number of patients (295) means a population who have the assessment of Modified Hoehn & Yahr rating scale at baseline and at least one post-visit after administration of pramipexole.

group.title: Pramipexole
group.description: The drug was administered orally to patients according to the package insert in Japan. The drug form is only tablet. The initial dose was 0.125 mg twice a day, and was escalated in case of lack of efficacy. The maintenance dose was between 1.5 mg/day and 4.5 mg/day (0.5 mg - 1.5 mg three times a day).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
